definition: (of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]
knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)
to exist/to deposit/to store/to keep/to survive

sentences.english: My bank statement shows a balance of 150 pounds.
sentences.chinese: 我的銀行結單顯示結存150英鎊。

sentences.english: My bank statement shows a balance of 150$.
sentences.chinese: 我的銀行顯示結存150美元。

sentences.english: I meant I must improve my bank balance. I was thinking of taking another job.
sentences.chinese: 我是說我定要改善銀行結存，我在想找另一份工作。

sentences.english: Once the investment account is exhausted, the policy shall be terminated.
sentences.chinese: 當投資賬戶內無結存金額，本保單即告終止。

sentences.english: I have a balance of $500 in the bank…
sentences.chinese: 我在銀行裏結存了500美元。

sentences.english: I have to check the balance of my bank account and withdraw some money.
sentences.chinese: 我要查一下銀行戶頭的結存餘額並提一些錢。

sentences.english: The balance remaining in your account is nine hundred dollars.
sentences.chinese: 你的帳戶結存金額是九百元。

definition: (computing) transcoding/to convert (from one encoding to another)
variant of 訂單|订单[ding4 dan1]

pinyin: guo2 min2 sheng1 chan3 zong3 zhi2
